result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean A Fairbert

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:01 AM Defendant Dean A Fairbert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Dean A Fairbert.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State has filed a motion to use video-taped interviews. He filed another motion this morning for another interview and gives videotape to the court. Attorney Kryshak states he has not viewed the videotapes and asks for a couple weeks to view them.
Court will set matter for another hearing.
State's Notice of Intent to Use Videotaped Statements at Trial
Motion hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Motion to Use Videotaped Statements of M.E.N.. at Trial Pursuant to Section 908.08, Wis. Stats.
State's Motion to Use Videotaped Statements of A.L.B. at Trial Pursuant to Section 908.08, Wis. Stats.
State's Motion to Use Videotaped Statements of L.R.P, at Trial Pursuant to Section 908.08, Wis. Stats.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:45 AM Defendant Dean A Fairbert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Dean A Fairbert.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives preliminary hearing and enters plea of not guilty to all counts. Bond is continued.
Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.

11:31 AM Defendant Dean A Fairbert in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Dean A Fairbert.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Rockley Gross appears by video and is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Oswald. He is an officer with the Marshfield Police Department. He received information of a sexual assault that occurred at a residence in the City of Marshfield. He spoke to defendant and he indicated that he and his wife provided babysitting services for a number of years. On 5/30/22, LRPR reported that while she was at the defendant's residence, the defendant sexually assaulted her. She was age 4 when it started. She described what happened and where in the house that it occurred.  He was made aware that IAS also made allegations against defendant. IAS stated that while she was being watched at defendant's residence defendant sexually assaulted her and she was about 8 or 9 years old then. IAS's mother confirmed that the defendant and his wife provided babysitting services for IAS during that time. Defendant denied the sexual assaults and he had a lot going on in his life. ALB also made allegations of sexual assault against defendant. The defendant is an uncle of ALB and ALB's mother confirmed that ALB would have sleepovers at defendant's house. Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. 
Attorney Oswald requests arraignment to be set at a later date as he may wish to modify the charges.
Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:38 PM Defendant Dean A Fairbert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Transferred to Branch 3 for preliminary hearing. Bond is continued.
No contact with alleged victims, IAS, LPR, ALB or their residences. No contact with anyone under age 18. 22-6759; 22-4281; 22-6761 $75,000

No contact w/victim or their residence - IAS, LPR, and ALB.
No contact w/ anyone under the age of 18.
